definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: drive, conduct (NH conduct oneself, behave, be accustomed; Ar. nahaja go along the road, keep to the road; Aram. [[נְהַג]] lead);—

drive, flocks Ex 3:1; cf. (in predict.) Is 11:6 (sq. [[בְּ]]); fig., obj. Joseph, Ps 80:2 (sim. of flock); hence, obj. human being, lead on, Ct So 8:2 (‖[[הֵבִיא אֶל־]])); also fig., subj. ´[[י]], La 3:2 (‖[[הוֹלִיח]]); pass. pt. of kings led in procession Is 60:11 cf. Di (rather than as captives, Che, as earlier usage; ‖[[הֵבִיא]]); drive away, off, (obj. [[מִקְנֶה]]) Ge 31:18 ( of Jacob, going by stealth); usually as booty (obj. flocks and herds) 1Sa 23:5, [[חמור יתומים ינהגו]] Job 24:3 (unjustly); cf. 1Sa 30:2, 1Sa 30:2 (rd. [[וַיִּנְהֲגוּ]] We Dr Kit Bu, cf. Th, not HPS q. v.), v:1Sa 30:22 (no obj. expr. but really captives ‖[[הָלַח]]), Is 20:4; drive an ass for riding 2Ki 4:24 (‖[[הָלַח]]); a cart ([[עֲגׇלָה]]) 2Sa 6:3 = 1Ch 13:7 (where ´[[בָּע]]); abs. of driving chariot 2Ki 9:20; lead out an army to battle (late) 1Ch 20:1, 2Ch 25:11.
fig. [[וְלִבִּי]] [[נׂהֵג בַּחָכְמָה]] Ec 2:3 my heart behaving itself in wisdom (cf. NH supr.).
drive away, lead off, sq. acc., daughters of Laban Ge 31:26 (‖[[גׇּנַב]]); of ´[[י]], leading off people into exile, sq. [[שָׁ֫מָּה]] De 4:27 (‖[[הֵפִיץ]]), De 28:37 (‖[[הוֹלִיח]]).
